header_summary:
The release of Bitcoin Core's new version, v28.3rc2, has been publicized, marking an important phase in the software development cycle with binaries available for download and an invitation for community feedback on the preliminary release notes. This version, available on [Bitcoin Core's official website](https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-28.3/test.rc2/) and its source code on [GitHub](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/v28.3rc2), is a critical step towards the final release, contingent on the detection of no significant issues during this candidate phase.

Carla et al. have advanced an updated reputation algorithm designed to fortify network security against various attacks, proving its efficacy through simulation tests. This enhancement emphasizes compensatory measures for nodes under resource attacks and introduces outgoing reputation to isolate malicious nodes swiftly. The ongoing development and real-world data analysis aim to optimize network resilience, encouraging community involvement through shared simulation tools and findings available at [Delving into Bitcoin](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/outgoing-reputation-simulation-results-and-updates/2069).

Moreover, 0xB10C has introduced a publicly accessible demo instance of the peer-observer, a project supported by [LCL Host](https://lclhost.org/) and detailed infrastructure definitions available on [GitHub](https://github.com/0xB10C/peer-observer-infra-demo). This initiative facilitates the exploration of Bitcoin's P2P network monitoring capabilities, underscoring the collaborative spirit of the development community. Additionally, ftw2100 proposes an innovative approach to integrate Zero-Knowledge verification into Bitcoin through a metaprotocol, leveraging existing infrastructure to reduce risks and encourage organic market adoption, further details of which can be found in their document [here](wtf.rich/w.pdf).

recent_posts.title: Bitcoin Core 28.3 Release Candidate 2 Available
recent_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core's new version v28.3rc2 has been announced, with binaries available for download.
- Preliminary release notes offer insights into the changes and improvements of the new version.
- This version serves as a test before potentially becoming the official v28.3 release.

recent_posts.title: Outgoing Reputation: Simulation Results and Updates
recent_posts.summary:
- The updated reputation algorithm effectively combats resource and sink attacks, ensuring financial stability.
- It introduces mechanisms like outgoing reputation to isolate malicious nodes, validated through simulations.
- Future plans include real-world data analysis to refine the algorithm and open community testing.

recent_posts.title: Peer-observer: A tool and infrastructure for monitoring the Bitcoin P2P network for attacks and anomalies
recent_posts.summary:
- A demo of the peer-observer is now publicly accessible, featuring two nodes, hal and len.
- The instance was sponsored by lclhost.org, supporting the project's development and public release.
- Technical details and infrastructure definition are available on GitHub for interested developers or IT professionals.

recent_posts.title: Proposal: OP_STARK_VERIFY - Native STARK Proof Verification in Bitcoin Script
recent_posts.summary:
- Integrating ZK verification into Bitcoin can use a metaprotocol, avoiding base protocol changes.
- This approach reduces risk, encourages market-driven adoption, and allows proof system evolution.
- Success of the metaprotocol could lead to native integration into Bitcoin Script in the future.

active_posts.title: Compact block relay in knots using the extra pool
active_posts.summary:
- A developer tested compact block relay in the Bitcoin network using Knots with specific configurations.
- The experiment showed a 90% success rate in block reconstruction, indicating efficient mempool synchronization.
- Insights and technical details were shared for improving compact block relay, inviting community feedback.

active_posts.title: Bitcoin Core v29.2 Released
active_posts.summary:
- Bitcoin Core version 29.2 introduces bug fixes, performance boosts, and updated translations.
- Users can report bugs on GitHub or join the announcement list via the official website.
- This version supports Linux Kernel 3.17+, macOS 13+, Windows 10+, and includes major updates.

active_posts.title: Stats on compact block reconstructions
active_posts.summary:
- The study explores Bitcoin network's block reconstruction efficiency using `debug=cmpctblock` logging.
- Node configuration changes, like increasing maximum connections, influenced block reconstruction outcomes.
- Findings suggest potential network-wide efficiency gains from altering Bitcoin Core's default transaction policies.

active_posts.title: Sharing block templates
active_posts.summary:
- Recent years show shifts in Bitcoin's mempool policies, including full replace-by-fee adoption.
- Compact block relay has enhanced network efficiency by reducing block propagation times significantly.
- Solutions like weak blocks and template sharing are being explored to optimize network performance.

active_posts.title: Eclipsing Bitcoin Nodes with BGP Interception Attacks
active_posts.summary:
- A stealthier variant of BGP hijacking threatens Bitcoin, enabling eclipse attacks via traffic interception.
- Attacker control over AS routes allows manipulation of Bitcoin traffic, risking double spending and mining power waste.
- Mitigations include peer rotation, dynamic port negotiation, and traceroute in Bitcoin Core to enhance network security.

today_in_history_posts.title: Draft BIP for SNICKER
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The email explores a Bitcoin watch-only issue and a proposed coinjoin-tx solution.
- Adam highlights the key tweak 'c' must be secret between proposer and receiver for security.
- He also discusses AES-GCM vs AES-CBC security and the value of current discussions.

today_in_history_posts.title: Rendez-vous on a Trampoline
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Bastien Teinturier proposed Bitcoin Trampoline to enhance Lightning Network's routing.
- The technique enables efficient payment routing but increases invoice size, affecting payment amount.
- Trampoline aims to improve multi-part payments and addresses payment failures while considering privacy trade-offs.

today_in_history_posts.title: Segwit Ephemeral Anchors
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Ephemeral Anchors are proposed for Bitcoin to allow "dusty" value outputs, requiring immediate mempool spending.
- This concept relies on Bitcoin's legacy script, making transactions vulnerable to ID malleability by miners.
- A new solution using bip141 and an undefined witness program reduces added bytes and improves efficiency.
